main event: A UFO sighting occurred near Nome, Alaska on December 6, 1957, involving one object with a flat trajectory and straight flight path, observed over a period of 20-30 seconds.
interesting points: The object was observed to have extreme brightness, several times the diameter of a star, and was seen descending almost to the ground near Gambell.
An additional bright green light was observed moving towards the object and later appeared to go into the object.
A whistling noise was heard over the area of the greatest activity.
Radio interference or disturbance of radio reception was reported to have occurred during the sighting.
The object appeared to be self-luminous, and the incident was described as 'UNKNOWN'.
sighted object: one object with flat trajectory and straight flight path
